document.discussion_title: Versatile ESPN sportscaster John Saunders dies at 61
document.topic_text: Joe Faraoni Versatile ESPN sportscaster John Saunders dies at 61 In this May 12, 2013 photo provided by ESPN Images. John Saunders poses on the set of "The Sports Reporters" in Studio A in Bristol, Conn. Saunders, who has hosted "The Sports Reporters" for the last 15 years, has died, the ESPN announced Wednesday, Aug. 10, 2016. He was 61. (Joe Faraoni/ESPN Images via AP) Posted: Wednesday, August 10, 2016 7:05 pm | Updated: 1:02 am, Thu Aug 11, 2016. Versatile ESPN sportscaster John Saunders dies at 61 Associated Press | NEW YORK (AP) — John Saunders, the versatile sportscaster who has hosted ESPN's "The Sports Reporters" for the last 15 years, has died, the network announced Wednesday. He was 61. Saunders joined ESPN in 1986. The Canadian did play-by-play, led NHL Stanley Cup and World Series coverage on ESPN and ABC, and hosted studio shows for baseball, college football and college basketball. John Saunders poses on the set of "The Sports Reporters" in Studio A in Bristol, Conn. Saunders, who has hosted "The Sports Reporters" for the last 15 years, has died, the ESPN announced Wednesday, Aug. 10, 2016. He was 61. (Joe Faraoni/ESPN Images via AP) Posted: Wednesday, August 10, 2016 7:05 pm | Updated: 1:02 am, Thu Aug 11, 2016. Versatile ESPN sportscaster John Saunders dies at 61 Associated Press | NEW YORK (AP) — John Saunders, the versatile sportscaster who has hosted ESPN's "The Sports Reporters" for the last 15 years, has died, the network announced Wednesday. He was 61. Saunders joined ESPN in 1986. The Canadian did play-by-play, led NHL Stanley Cup and World Series coverage on ESPN and ABC, and hosted studio shows for baseball, college football and college basketball.
